content: the held beanie was designed as part of the **crochet cancer challenge** hosted by sweet potato 3 patterns as a breast cancer survivor myself this cause is near and dear to me and so a portion of the proceeds from its sale will be donated to the american cancer society to help fund cancer research patient services and education this hat is made using bulky weight yarn and is written in **us terms** and an **intermediate skill level** it is graded for **3 adult sizes** small medium and large worked from the bottom up the double brim is worked in flat turned row before joining the ends to work the body in the round this pdf has everything you might need to make this pattern including photo tutorials and linked videos tutorials for the yarn over slip_stitch front post double_crochet and alpine stitch as well as supplemental pictures a stitch chart and a row/round tracker i also include tips and tricks along the way to help any novice pattern readers out there the pdf also has a consolidated version of the pattern for you more experienced crocheters who don t need all the tips and tricks along the way included in the pdf us terms english only * cover page with a large full-color photo of the finished item * required materials pattern notes etc including recommended yarns * yarn over slip_stitch tutorial * front post double_crochet tutorial * alpine stitch tutorial * detailed pattern with supplemental instructional photos notes and tips and tricks * consolidated pattern for more experienced crocheters * completion page with another large full-color photo of the finished item * stitch chart * row/round tracker other details * finished size adult small 22 head circumference medium 23 head circumference and large 24 head circumference * suggested
